clinical_study.brief_title: Echocardiographic Manifestation in Patient With Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)
clinical_study.official_title: Cardiac Structural and Functional Characteristics in Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19): A Dynamic Echocardiographic Study

brief_summary.textblock: The pandemic of 2019 novel coronavirus-infected pneumonia (COVID-19) has become a global health crisis and caused many casualties.This study measured echocardiographic indexes of a cohort of patients admitted of COVID-19 in a designated hospital in Wuhan, China, aiming to provide referential information for medical staff fighting the disease in the front line.

detailed_description.textblock: The pandemic of 2019 novel coronavirus-infected pneumonia (COVID-19) has become a global health crisis and caused many casualties. Although acute respiratory syndrome is the main manifestation of the disease, the understanding of the impact of the virus on other organs is of very importance in terms of the treatment, especially for patients with severe or critical conditions. Some studies have reported that a certain percentage of patients presented cardiac injury as indicated by elevated cardiac biomarkers and B-type natriuretic peptide (BNP) as well as abnormal electrocardiogram (ECG) . However, it is less known whether cardiac functions will be remarkably affected in these patients. Therefore, this study measured echocardiographic indexes of a cohort of patients admitted of COVID-19 in a designated hospital in Wuhan, China, aiming to provide referential information for medical staff fighting the disease in the front line.

primary_outcome.description: a composite of death, in-hospital acute heart failure, cardiac resuscitation and stroke.

arm_group.description: Patients presented with any of the following manifestations was regarded as having abnormal echocardiography in the study: 1) Left ventricular ejection fraction≤50%. 2) Moderate or severe mitral regurgitation. 3) Pulmonary artery systolic pressure (PASP) ≥40 millimetres of mercury(mmHg). 4) Tricuspid annular plane systolic excursion (TAPSE) <16 millimetre(mm). Further classification as left or right heart dysfunction will be given in the study.

intervention.description: An expert with 17-year professional experience performed all the echocardiography examinations using a GE LOGIQTM e portable color ultrasound diagnostic machine (GE Healthcare, WI, USA) that was specially used in the contaminated area. Two-dimensional and Doppler echocardiographic measurements were conducted following the recommendations of the American Society of Echocardiography

study_pop.textblock: Patients admitted in an intensive care unit (ICU) during February 22 to April 3, 2019 in a special hospital for COVID-19 patients in Wuhan, China

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with confirmed COVID-19 diagnosis based on symptom, virus test and chest computed tomography (CT).
2. Patients having at least one time echocardiography examination during hospitalization.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients not confirmed with COVID-19 diagnosis.
2. Patients not having echocardiography examination during the study period.
